title: FANTASY WINGS PACK 1
longDescription:
Listen to the watermarked demo of some of the sounds:

CLICK HERE


FANTASY WINGS PACK1: Unleash the Sounds of Flight Immerse yourself in the fantastical world of flight with FANTASY WINGS PACK1, an extensive collection of high-quality wing flapping sounds that will elevate your game’s audio landscape to new heights. From the tiniest buzz of insect wings to the mighty whoosh of dragon wings, this pack is meticulously categorized into three distinct sections: Insect Wings, Small Wings, and Large Wings, ensuring you find the perfect sound for any scenario.


Insect Wings: Delicate yet bustling, the Insect Wings category captures the essence of nature’s smallest aviators. Each sound is crafted to bring to life the flutter of butterfly wings, the rapid beat of a bee’s wings, or the gentle swoosh of a ladybug taking flight.


Small Wings: The Small Wings section features a variety of birds, from the humble sparrow to the majestic falcon. These sounds are perfect for scenes of serene skies or bustling forests, providing a realistic backdrop for your avian characters.


Large Wings: Designed for the creatures that dominate the skies in your games, the Large Wings category includes both dry and reverbed versions to suit different environments. Whether it’s a dragon soaring through a mountain pass or an eagle gliding over open waters, these sounds add a powerful and epic dimension to your audio.


Suitable for RPGs, adventure games, and any fantasy setting, FANTASY WINGS PACK1 is an essential audio asset for developers looking to bring authenticity and depth to their game’s soundscape.

Only the products image is CreatedWithAI
technicalDetails:
Features: 


Large Wing Flaps

Large Wing Flaps (Reverbed)

Small Wing Flaps

Insect Wing Flaps


Number of Audio Waves: 126


Number of Audio Cues: 126


Sample rate / bit rate: 44.1 KHz 16 Bit


Do Sound FX loop: No


Minutes of audio provided:


Supported Development Platforms:


Windows: Yes


Mac: Yes

releaseInfo.releaseNote: All files amplitude made relatively similar to each other and spatial spread controlled
